lines.text: [as Ben moves Captain Ron's beer]
Hey. Get your hands off that.
I was just moving it. I wasn't gonna drink it.
You bet your little booty, you wasn't. You want a beer, you get your own beer.
Captain Ron, I was wondering. Are we going to be going to any more "human" type places?
Well, you heard of St. Croix?
Yeah.
We're going to the island just to the left of it.
What's it called?
Ted's.
Alright, that's more like it, now you're talking! You can do it, mates! I've never seen such sailors. Not in all my born days, I ain't. Naturals! My God, everyone of you, naturals...
[beat; to himself]
We're gonna fucking die!

[to Ben]
Hey swab. C'mere. Listen up. Now, the way it works shipboard is, you do your job. You do it good, you get a better job. Maybe you get promoted from swab to mate.
[Ben nods]
Alright. Get on it.

[to Martin]
Sort've an incentive kind of a deal, huh?
Ah. Good.
Yeah, incentives are important. I learned that in rehab.

[after losing his glass eye]
It never did fit anyway. Guess you gotta get 'em custom made.
[Lost in a heavy storm]
The boss is right. We should be okay. 'Cause I know we're near land.
Great, Cap. Great. Ya hear that? We're almost there. Explain to the kids how you know that, Captain Ron. Someone translate for General Armando.
When we left, we had just enough fuel to make it to San Juan. And now... we are out of fuel!
Slow down! There's boats all over the place!
Don't worry. They'll get out of the way. I learned that driving the Saratoga.
Hey! Uh, leg feels a lot better now, boss. I always been a fast healer, you know. 'Course I believe in Jesus, so that helps.
We'll be spontaneous when we have time.
Man. What happened to your eye?
Ben.
Sweetie, that's rude.
No, that's alright. Shark attack, swab.
A shark ate your eye?

[telling how he lost his eye]
Yeah, it happened when I went down off the coast of Australia.
Your boat sank?
No, no, no, no. Not my boat. My boss's boat. Yeah, we hit this reef. Huge son-of-a-bitch. Ran the whole coast.
Wait. The Great Barrier Reef?
You've heard of it, huh? Smart lady.
[Approaching Martin and Katherine in a holding cell on San Juan]
Mr. and Mrs. Harvey? I'm Bill Zachary from the U.S. State Department. I've got some good news for you.
Oh. You found our children.
No. But you're not being charged with subversion.

[Overhearing his parents]
Wow. We're getting a boat? Too cool.
Ben, remember our discussion about eavesdropping?
Okay. But we're getting a boat?
Your father and I have to talk about it.
Alright. We're getting a boat.
The American girls are very... what's the word? Superficial.
Yeah. God, I really hate that. Like, I'm into different cultures and different ways of doing things. Like we're watching "Mr. Ed" on TV the other day, and he's speaking French, or something.
Captain Ron! Captain Ron?
What are we going to do?

What can we do? Look around you. The sun is almost up. We are marooned in an unfriendly country. We have no luggage, no money, no passports and worse still... no reason or explination for even being here!
But we have our boat.
No dear. If you'll look again, you'll notice that the pirates have our boat.
Now, wait a minute. That's our boat. We should do something.
What are you saying?
I think she's saying that if the pirates have our boat, we should take it back from them. I say we fight them.
Bloodthirsty, heavily armed Cuban pirates against the Harvey clan? It would take a miracle.
[just then a 1950s retro car speeds by them]
Look! It's Captain Ron!
[being chased by pirates]
All right! They're pirates of the Caribbean, just you said Captain Ron.
Yeah, squirt. Pirates are easy to deal with. It's the Cuban cops that you gotta worry about. Grand theft auto is a major biggie here in Cuba.
Grand theft auto? You stole this car?
Nah, I didn't steal it, boss. I borrowed it. Sort of...

[Walks down to the Ship's Cabin]
What's this?
Monopoly.
No, this.
[Holding a handgun]
Two .45's and a Mac-10.
It's this total macho trip, Dad, just ignore it.
Where'd they come from?
Captain Ron traded the Guerrillas for 'em.
Yeah, I thought we'd ought to have them, Boss. Cause, you know, we're gettin' into pirate waters, here, pretty quick.
What pirates?
Pirates, of the Caribbean.
Been to Disney World, one too many times? Have we, Captain Ron?
It's true, Dad! They come up on you in high speed boats!
You know, I don't believe I've been to Disney World...
[Interrupted by Martin Harvey]
I've been to DollyWood.
A diesel loves her oil same as a sailor loves rum
Hey, you wouldn't be trying to cheat Captain Ron there, would you, swab?
Uh, no sir. Uh, so what happened?
Ah, nothing. They were just playing hide-the-salami in the shower

[Ben spits his beer up]
Oh, come on, man!

[Captain Ron has left Martin at the wheel to pilot the boat alone. His wife comes and stands next to him]
Isn't this great? Look at this! Open ocean, uncharted islands... Who knows what's waiting for us out there? Come here.
[hugs his wife]
Day two. The adventure begins! What a thrill it is to be leaving the turmoil of civilization behind us!
What about your other eye?
Glass, swab.
Too cool!
Yeah. I won it in a crap game a few years back.
What do you think about Captain Ron? I mean, uh, I would be certainly willing to provide someone else if you're not comfortable with him. I think it's important that you're, uh...
No, I think he's fine... I mean, he seems to know what he's doing. He was in the Navy.
Yeah, yeah, all right... What about the eye thing, though?

Oh, honey! I would never fire anybody because they were physically challenged. Frankly, I admire him. I mean, really, when you think about the way he parked that boat. It was unbelievable - I mean, especially for somebody with no depth perception as we know it.

[not sounding completely convinced of that notion]
Oh, yeah, yeah, he's good...
You stole my wife, but you're not gonna steal my car!
